result.execSummary:
Christopher J. Goyer was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Christopher J. Goyer was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J. Goyer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Court Reporter:  Jodie Guhr
[MK] case called at 12:10pm. 
Defendant Christopher J. Goyer in court, in custody, with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court discloses that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Goyer. The Court does not recall or recognize Mr. Goyer. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
The Court informs Mr. Goyer of his extradition rights. 
Mr. Goyer indicates that he understands his extradition rights and he is waiving them.  Mr. Goyer signs the Waiver of Extradition and Hearing form in triplicate.
The Court accepts this waiver by Mr. Goyer. 
recess 12:15pm.

Case called at 1:29 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Christopher J. Goyer appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Atty Dahnert informs the Court that Mr. Goyer qualifies for SPD representation
Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Atty Dahnert informs the Court that Mr. Goyer will not be contesting extradition

Court requires a $10,000 CASH bond, with no special conditions:
Recess: 1:33 pm 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Extradition Waiver Hearing ASAP- Send notices
